citeinfo.title: Social Vulnerability Index, Region 9, 2011, US EPA Region 9

descript.abstract: The Social Vulnerability Index is derived from the 2000 US Census data. The fields included are percent minority, median household income, age (under 18 and over 64), population without a high school diploma, linguistically isolated households, and single female head of households with own children under 18 (single moms). The data is at the block group level. Each field for each block group is assigned an index score of 0-3, based on whether the value of that dataset falls in the top quartile (score=3), second quartile (score=2), third quartile (score=1), or bottom quartile (score=0). The scores for each field are then added together to assign a comprehensive score to each block group (0-21). The highest scores are block groups that have the highest percentage of sensitive populations (highest percent minority, lowest per capita income, highest percent of population under 18 and over 64, highest percentage of population without a high school degree, highest percent of linguistically isolated households, and highest percent of single female head of households). Zoe Heller of the US EPA Region 9's Communities and Ecosystems Division, is responsible for the design and development of the Social Vulnerability Index data set.
descript.purpose: The social vulnerability index was developed to determine where the most socially vulnerable populations are within Region 9.

idinfo.accconst: Check with Zoe Heller, EPA Region 9, before distributing
idinfo.useconst: please do not use until consulting with Zoe Heller in the EJ program and Cheryl Henley, GIS Coordinator
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.0.1770

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.
dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness

horizpa.horizpar: Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at http://epa.gov/geospatial/policies.html)

procstep.procdesc: Dataset copied.
Dataset copied.
Downloaded California, Arizona, Hawaii, and Nevadas SF3 data (ascii text file) from the US Census Bureau (http://www2.census.gov/census_2000/datasets/Summary_File_3/)
Downloaded Summary File 3 template files (http://www.census.gov/support/cen2000_sf3ASCII.html#Access)

Imported each states relevant SF3 data into Access including (SF3, P6), median household income (SF3, P53), percent population younger than 18 years old and percent population older than 64 years old (SF3, P8), percent population older than 25 without a high school diploma (SF3, P37), percent of linguistically isolated households (SF3, P20), percent single female head of household with own children under 18 (SF3, P10), and (SF3, P1) total weighted population.
Import the geo table from the ascii SF3 data into the SF3 template.
Create a field called STCO_BG that combines the state, county, tract and block group codes for each census tract.
Query to create a table with just the relevant SF3 data.
Export the data into excel. Each state separately.
Sum total minority population, calculate percent minority
Sum total under 18, calculate percent under 18
Sum total over 64, calculate percent over 64
Sum total population over 25 without a high school diploma, calculate percent of total population over 25 without a high school diploma
Sum total number of linguistically isolated households, calculate percent of linguistically isolated households.

Sum total number of single female head of households with own children under 18 living in the home, calculate percent of single female head of households with own children under 18 living in the home.

Used quartile function in Excel to identify quartile cut offs for each field. Assigned a zero to the least vulnerable quartile for each field (lowest percent minority, least population under 18, least population over 64, least population over 25 without a high school diploma, lowest percent of linguistically isolated households, lowest percent of single female head of households, highest median household income). Assigned a 1 to the next quartile. Assigned a 2 to the next quartile. Assigned a 3 to the most vulnerable quartile.
Summed the quartile scores together to get a Social Vulnerability Index Score (1-21)
Imported to ArcMap and joined with existing census block group data.
Metadata imported.
Metadata imported.
Dataset copied.
Dataset copied.
Dataset copied.

enttyp.enttypd: 2000 census block group information to deteremine which census tracts in EPA, Region 9 are the most socially vulnerable

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
Block Group ID
two letter abbreviation of the state
unique logical record number
numerical state code
numerical county code
numerical tract code
numerical block group code
land area in census block group
water area in census block group
Total population in the block group (SF3, P001001)
Block group's population that is not white (SF3, P007001-P007003)
Percent of block group's population that is not white. (MinPop/P007001)

Percent minority is divided into quartiles. The lowest percent minority quartile (least vulnerable) scores a 0, the next highest scores a 1, the next highest scores a 2, and the highest (most vulnerable) scores a 3.
Total population in the block group under the age 18 (sf3, sum(P008003:P008020)+sum(P008042:P008059))
Percent of block group's population that is under the age 18 (PopUnd18/P008001)

Percent under 18 is divided into quartiles. The lowest percent under 18 quartile (least vulnerable) scores a 0, the next highest scores a 1, the next highest scores a 2, and the highest (most vulnerable) scores a 3.
Population over 64
Total population in the block group over the age of 64 (sf3, sum(P008035:P008040)+sum(P008074:P008079))

Percent over 64 is divided into quartiles. The lowest percent over 64 quartile (least vulnerable) scores a 0, the next highest scores a 1, the next highest scores a 2, and the highest (most vulnerable) scores a 3.
Total number of households in the block group (sf3, P010001)
Total number of households in the block group with female head of household, no husband present, with own children under 18 years (sf3, P010015)
Percent of households in the block group with female head of household, no husband present, with own childen under 18 years (SingMom/PO10001)

attrdomv.udom: percent of households with single mothers

attr.attrdef: Percent of single mothers is divided into quartiles. The lowest quartile (least vulnerable) scores a 0, the next highest scores a 1, the next highest scores a 2, and the highest (most vulnerable) scores a 3.
Total number of households in the block group that are liguistically isolated, a household where all members 14 and over have some difficulty with English (sf3, P020004+P020007+P020010+P010013)
Percent of households in the block group that are linguistically isolated (LingIso/P020001)

Percent of linguistically isolated households is divided into quartiles. The lowest percent of linguistically isolated households quartile (least vulnerable) scores a 0, the next highest scores a 1, the next highest scores a 2, and the highest (most vulnerable) scores a 3.
Total population in the block group over 25 (sf3, P037001)
Total population in the block group over 25 without a high school diploma (sf3, sum(P037003:P037010)+sum(P037020:P037027)

attrdomv.udom: total population over 25 without a high school diploma

attr.attrdef: Percent of population in the block group that is over 25 and does not have a high school diploma (WOSHDip/P037001)

attrdomv.udom: percent of total population over 25 without a high school diploma

attr.attrdef: Percent without a high school diploma is divided into quartiles. The lowest percent without a high school diploma quartile (least vulnerable) scores a 0, the next highest scores a 1, the next highest scores a 2, and the highest (most vulnerable) scores a 3.
Median Household Income (sf3, P53001)

Median houseold income is divided into quartiles. The highest median household income quartile (least vulnerable) scores a 0, the next lowest scores a 1, the next lowest scores a 2, and the lowest (most vulnerable) scores a 3.
This number represents the social vulnerability index score. The sum of MinSVI, Und18SVI, Ov64SVI, SingMomSVI, LingIsoSVI, WOHSDipSVI, and MedHHIncSVI.

idCitation.resTitle: Social Vulnerability Index Polygons, Region 9, 2011, US EPA Region 9

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The Social Vulnerability Index is derived from the 2000 US Census data. The fields included are percent minority, median household income, age (under 18 and over 64), population without a high school diploma, linguistically isolated households, and single female head of households with own children under 18 (single moms). The data is at the block group level. Each field for each block group is assigned an index score of 0-3, based on whether the value of that dataset falls in the top quartile (score=3), second quartile (score=2), third quartile (score=1), or bottom quartile (score=0). The scores for each field are then added together to assign a comprehensive score to each block group (0-21). The highest scores are block groups that have the highest percentage of sensitive populations (highest percent minority, lowest per capita income, highest percent of population under 18 and over 64, highest percentage of population without a high school degree, highest percent of linguistically isolated households, and highest percent of single female head of households). Zoe Heller of the US EPA Region 9's Communities and Ecosystems Division, is responsible for the design and development of the Social Vulnerability Index data set.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: The social vulnerability index was developed to determine where the most socially vulnerable populations are within Region 9.
